lexUnit.name: cape.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sleeveless cloak, especially a short one.

sentence.text: Finn dancing in his stained vest and Francie playing the fiddle like the devil himself , who had been a fiddler , and the dumb aunt in a cape of fiery hair whistling along a flute .
The officer 's optional dark blue cape , with a black velvet collar , and a black cord fastening , seen here hanging on the left breast .
The seneschal had gone quiet at that and sunk his thin grey face back into his hooded cape , while the huge human stood glaring at him , quivering with impotent rage .
As I wrapped myself in my gas cape and crouched down in a corner of the trench , I gazed up at the sky .
A goofy individual in a Batman cape distracted her attention by falling into the seat to her left , spilling some champagne in the process .
Left alone , she admired Katarina 's beautiful jewelled brocade dress beneath the heavy wool cape .
She drew on sensible boots and a warm woollen cape and called for the carriage to be brought round to the front .
It 's a cape with a swan-neck fastening chain .
I had my cape over my shoulder and a milk bottle .
As well as the long-muzzled , black-fanged mask , I had a swirling ankle-length cape in black and green to represent the wings .

The Chiefs and notables were gorgeous in mantles of crimson , blue or green velvet , richly embroidered with gold thread , worn over silken shirts ; some had lion- or leopard-skin capes draped about their shoulders .
He was habited youthfully , in black jacket and trousers , over which he had a dripping cape .
He was wearing a waterproof cape over his white sweater and had changed into knee-length rubber boots .
She stepped inside and , still wearing the soaked cape , ready at an instant to flee , sat down at her desk .
In the early morning light he could see that she wore a black cape over a dark red dress .
Emily took off her cape feeling she had found an ally .
